titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 5ra-127va) I-1) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos), Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 5ra-14rb); miracle (fols. 14rb-16ra); commemorative notice (fols. 16ra-18vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 18vb) I-2) Homily by an anonymous author for Taḫśaś (fols. 19ra-26va); miracle (fols. 26va-27vb); commemorative notice (fols. 27vb-28va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 28va) I-3) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for Ṭǝrr (fols. 28vb-41va); miracle (fols. 41va-42va); commemorative notice (fols. 42va-43ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 43ra) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for Yäkkatit (fols. 43ra-47rb); miracle (fols. 47rb-48vb); commemorative notice (fols. 48vb-49rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 49rb-va) I-5) Homily by [Severus] Patriarch of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 49va-70vb); miracle (fols. 70vb-72va); commemorative notice (fol. 72va-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 72vb-73rb) I-6) Homily by [Metropolitan] Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox for Miyazya (fols. 73ra-78va); miracle (fols. 78vb-80vb); commemorative notice (fol. 81ra-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 81va-vb) I-7) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 81va-83vb); miracle (fols. 83vb-85vb); commemorative notice (fols. 85vb-86rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 86rb) I-8) Homily by [Yoḥannǝs], Metropolitan of ʾAksum [for Säne] (fols. 86va-94ra); miracle (fols. 94ra-95va); commemorative notice (fols. 95va-103va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 103va-vb) I-9) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] for Ḥamle (fols. 103vb-108va); miracle (fols. 108va-109va); commemorative notice (fols. 109va-110ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 110rb) I-10) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 110ra-113ra); miracle (fols. 113ra-114ra); commemorative notice (fol. 114ra-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 114va-vb) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 114va-117va); miracle (fols. 117va-120ra); commemorative notice (fol. 120ra-rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 120rb-vb) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 120va-124rb); miracle (fols. 124va-126va); commemorative notice (fols. 126va-127rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 127rb-va)
Additio 1.

originlink.xlink:title: ʿAddigrat Däbrä Mänkәrat Qәddus Qirqos / AMQ

locationlink.xlink:title: ʿAddigrat Däbrä Mänkәrat Qәddus Qirqos / AMQ

donors.donor: The following names are written in red in a secondary hand at the end of Additio 1 as well as throughout the Ms.: Wäldä Yoḥannǝs, Gäbrä Mikaʾel, Ḫaylä Maryam, Wälättä Giyorgis, Wälättä Mädḫǝn, ʾAskalä Maryam.

txstates.txstate: Good. Holes or tears amended on fols. 68, 71, 90, 113, 115, 120.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards, covered with reddish brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: fourfold line fillet, triple circle, x-from, criss cross).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 5r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – X(10/fols. 74r-83v) – XI(10/fols. 84r-93v) – XII(8/fols. 94r-103v) – XIII(10/fols. 104r-113v) – XIV(10/fols. 114r-123v) – XV(8/fols. 124r-131v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line on fol. 7ra.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by a broad, rounded and upright (or slightly left-sloping) script with distinctive features: - many letters have hairlines, esp. at the top (e.g., ለ, ረ, ሰ, ት, ዕ) - some letters have forked elements (e.g., ኀ, ተ ) - the characters መ and ሠ in all vowel orders are often set on the baseline (e.g., fol. 18vb) - the letters እ and ለ are sometimes difficult to distinguish (e.g., fol. 19ra l. 14 against fol. 81vb l.5) - the vowel markers of ዮ and ድ are often attached at the very top of the letter's body (e.g., fols. 81vab, 110ra).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines on the incipit page of all sections (alternating with black lines); incipits of all subsections; each second letter in the initial lines of the Additio; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 70vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 72vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The scribe interrupted on fol. 30va and started again on fol. 31ra probably leaving the space for the miniature.

additional.det: The prayer is written by the same hand as the main text.

extras.extra: - Omissions inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 7vb, 9rb, 44vb, 67ra. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 22rb, 46ra-b [several lines], 46va. - Tämälläs-sign (in the shape of +) indicating the place where the omission, written in the bottom margin, belong: fol. 81va. - Crude drawings and scribbles: fols. 1r, 2r, 130r, 131v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin, in red or black: ዘታኅሳስ፡ fol. 19ra ዘጥር፡ fol. 28vb ዘመጋቢት፡ fol. 49va ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 73ra ዘግንቦት: fol. 81va ዘሰኔ: fol. 86va ዘሐምሌ: fol. 103vb The indications for the months ሕዳር, የካቲት, መስከረም and ጥቅምት are missing.

miniature.info: Fol. 9v: St. Michael holding a staff.
Fol. 30v: St. Michael holding a sword, below the devil depicted with three horns.
Fol. 128rb: St. Michael and the Three Youths in the Fiery Furnace.
Fol. 128v: St. Michael with a sword and Pharaoh's troops (?).
miniature.details: Legend: ሚካኤል "Michael", መልአክ "Angel" The legend is crudely written in pen.

miniature.info: Fol. 129r: St. Michael with two swords, below the Pharaoh and his troops in the sea.
miniature.details: Legend: ገብርኤል "Gabriel", ፈርኦን፡... "Pharaoh..." The legend is crudely written in pen and barely legible.

miniature.info: Fol. 129v: St. Michael in a crown sitting on a horse, below a human figure.
miniature.details: Legend: ሚካኤል... "Michael...". The legend is crudely written in pen and barely legible.

frames.frame: Fol. 5r (incipit page of Text I): coloured (red, blue and black) ornamental band; interlaces and floral motifs.
